In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **tilde** (**\~**) serves the following purposes:

- \~ is the tail of a [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm").
- \~ represents the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square").

* [In a menu](/wiki/Menu_controls "Menu controls"), pressing [\~]() inverts the selection on the current page.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)
- [2 Variants](#Variants)
  - [2.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
- [3 References](#References)

## Historical uses

In [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0") only, the lurker above uses the \~ glyph. Hack 1.0 also introduces the long worm tail with its current glyph.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

The vibrating square is given the tilde to represent it in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1").

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the [hunting horror](/wiki/Hunting_horror "Hunting horror") is a multi-segmented monster similar to the long worm that has its tail segments represented by \~.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [hack.worm.c in Hack 1.0, line 45](/wiki/Source:Hack_1.0/hack.worm.c#line45 "Source:Hack 1.0/hack.worm.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [hack.worm.c in Hack 1.0, line 104](/wiki/Source:Hack_1.0/hack.worm.c#line104 "Source:Hack 1.0/hack.worm.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
~

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the tilde (~) serves the following purposes:

  • ~ is the tail of a long worm.
  • ~ represents the vibrating square.
  • In a menu, pressing ~ inverts the selection on the current page.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 dNetHack
  • 3 References

Historical uses

In Hack 1.0 only, the lurker above uses the ~ glyph. Hack 1.0 also introduces the long worm tail with its current glyph.[1][2]

The vibrating square is given the tilde to represent it in NetHack 3.6.1.

Variants

dNetHack

In dNetHack, the hunting horror is a multi-segmented monster similar to the long worm that has its tail segments represented by ~.

References

  1. ↑ hack.worm.c in Hack 1.0, line 45
  2. ↑ hack.worm.c in Hack 1.0, line 104

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the '''tilde''' ('''~''') serves the following purposes:

* {{monsym|long worm tail}} is the tail of a [[long worm]].
* {{magenta|~}}  represents the [[vibrating square]].

* [[Menu controls|In a menu]], pressing {{kbd|~}} inverts the selection on the current page.

==Historical uses==
In [[Hack 1.0]] only, the lurker above uses the {{white|~}} glyph. Hack 1.0 also introduces the long worm tail with its current glyph.{{refsrc|hack.worm.c|45|version=Hack 1.0}}{{refsrc|hack.worm.c|104|version=Hack 1.0}}

The vibrating square is given the tilde to represent it in [[NetHack 3.6.1]].

==Variants==
===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], the [[hunting horror]] is a multi-segmented monster similar to the long worm that has its tail segments represented by {{yellow|~}}.

==References==
<references/>
